parameters: Fade out the screen and show the black bars for the cinematic effect.
Since we aren't using the player, we're going to need to halt
his movement and prevent menu opening, to do this we can simply
use a switch. Without this happening, the player can click to
move the player which will reveal the box-clicky thing
switch to stop movement and prevent opening menu
Change the blank events to mimick our party, set their location, and
make our current party hidden. Uncheck "wait for completion" in set movement
change screens tint and start a screen scroll, then fade in
First, we'll tint it all the way black to make the smooth
Now we fade in the screen to the desired color for 120 frames, or 2 seconds
Move the new party to the left, just before the baddy jumps down
and stops them. Uncheck wait for completion once again and estimate
or playtest to find out how many frames you'll need to wait before
the next action. We want harold to face Therese before she's done moving.
This can also be done in set move rout for harold, but either way works
For therese's last step, we're going to make her walk a bit
We start the dialogue. Make sure the window is transparent, and
you only use the 2 bottom lines of text. We're going to use show
picture to slide in the emotes
-- Start the picture at 734 x and 530 y
Slide it to 730 x and 530 y for about 20 frames, don't wait for
Yes, I take interest in every one of importance who passes through the city - \|\|\^
- gates of Rinsar. I know why you’re here. You’re wasting your time. \|\|\^
Yes, I won’t be extending support for Prince Lansee. He is a lost cause. - \|\|\^
- I know for a family like yours it’s hard to understand what the houses - \|\|\^
- of a lesser status go through. I mean did you even contemplate what happened - \|\|\^
- to the rest of Haffenden when your family fled? \|\|\^
We… we didn’t have a choice! \|\|\^
Yes, you did. You always have a choice. I think I’ve made my thoughts - \|\|\^
- clear. Now I believe we’re done here. \|\|\^
You obtained Lord Halacre's Entry in the Journal.

Cedric, I am good. What can I do for you? Who am I kidding? I know why you’re - \|\|\^
So you know what I’m asking? \|\|\^
Yes, but just like the last time you asked me, the answer is no. It is a - \|\|\^
- lost cause trying to remove Roswell and frankly I believe he is the - \|\|\^
Roswell conquered nearly all the kingdoms in the realm, only four are not - \|\|\^
- part of his dominion. A betting man would put their gold on Roswell. \|\|\^
We won the battle in Luthania. \|\|\^
Yes, you won the battle but not the war and I heard that there were quite a - \|\|\^
- few fatalities on the Luthanian side which would make it a narrow victory. - \|\|\^
- I hope you see where I am going with this Lord Cedric? \|\|\^
Do you? You haven’t realised you and Roswell are playing two different games. - \|\|\^
- You can’t beat an opponent if there isn’t one to begin with. \|\|\^
When you find out what Roswell is after you will. As for now, you should see - \|\|\^
- if you can muster up a force from the other lords because you won't get - \|\|\^
Lord Halacre's entry in the Journal was updated.
Would you like to save game?

Lord Cedric and King Dormato in my home?! The pleasure is all mine. \|\|\^
I’m afraid that pleasure will be short lived. \|\|\^
I am sorry for my lack of support in regards to Roswell. But all odds were - \|\|\^
You said we were playing two different games. Maybe it was that you didn’t - \|\|\^
- understand the game in general. You said that I couldn’t beat him yet he’s - \|\|\^
- dead and I’m here. Sadly, you won’t be here to see how Rinsar flourishes - \|\|\^
- when it goes along the right path. Take him. \|\|\^
You can’t be serious?! I am a Lord! You will regret your decisions. \|\|\^
